movies.title: The Devil's Playground
movies.plot: Fred Schepisi's film, 'The Devil's Playground' is an intimate portrait of Tom, a thirteen-year-old struggling in spirit and body with the constraints of living in a Catholic seminary. It is also the story of the Brothers and how they cope with the demands of their faith.
movies.simplePlot: Fred Schepisi's film, 'The Devil's Playground' is an intimate portrait of Tom, a thirteen-year-old struggling in spirit and body with the constraints of living in a Catholic seminary. It is...

biography.bio: Charles McCallum was born in 1901 in New Zealand. He was an actor, known for The Devil's Playground (1976), Montclare: Rendez-vous de l'horreur (1982) and Seven Little Australians (1939). He was married to Clare. He died on February 12, 1992 in Randwick, Sydney, New South Wales, Australia.
biography.name: Charles McCallum

biography.bio: John Frawley was born in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia. He was an actor, known for The Devil's Playground (1976), The Last Wave (1977) and La nuit, un rôdeur (1978). He died on March 3, 1999 in Melbourne.
biography.name: John Frawley

biography.placeOfBirth: Lord Howe Island, New South Wales, Australia
biography.bio: Arthur Dignam was born on September 9, 1939 in Lord Howe Island, New South Wales, Australia. He is an actor, known for Moulin Rouge (2001), Australia (2008) and The Devil's Playground (1976).
biography.name: Arthur Dignam

biography.bio: Nick Tate was born on June 18, 1942 in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia as Nicholas John Tate. He is an actor and director, known for Killer Elite (2011), Gatsby le magnifique (2013) and Hook (1991).
biography.name: Nick Tate

biography.bio: Peter Cox is an actor, known for The Devil's Playground (1976), Future Schlock (1984) and Monkey Grip (1982).
biography.name: Peter Cox

biography.bio: Bushy-browed, New Zealand-born actor and writer Jonathan Hardy became most familiar to television audiences as the commanding voice of the Jim Henson Creature Shop muppet, Dominar Rygel XVI, the pint-sized , egocentric ruler-in-exile of a galactic empire, in TV's cult series Farscape (1999). His distinctive diction proved ideally suited to lending both humour and personality to the cantankerous, idiosyncratic 26-inch Hynerian. Jonathan was educated at St. Patrick's College and Victoria University in Wellington, and trained for acting at the New Zealand Player's Drama School. In later years, he became a force in his country's theatrical scene as artistic director of the Auckland Mercury Theatre, from 1980 to 1985. Prior to that, he had studied at the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art on a scholarship, and subsequently spent ten years gaining valuable experience on British stages -- with the National Theatre, the Bristol Old Vic and with the Royal Shakespeare Company in Stratford-upon Avon. Back in the antipodes, he was especially acclaimed for his performance as Willy Loman in an Auckland Theatre Company production of "Death of a Salesman". With the same organisation, he had another winning role in "Twelve Angry Men". After moving to Australia in 1972, Jonathan was notably featured in the films The Mango Tree (1977) and Mad Max (1979), and had guest spots on popular television shows like Prisoner: Cell Block H (1979) and The Flying Doctors (1986). He also made occasional forays into screenwriting. His first, for the controversial Boer war drama Breaker Morant (1980), won him an Oscar nomination (along with Bruce Beresford and David Stevens), and an Australian Film Institute Award. In the cast of the two-act play "Breaker Morant", debuting at the Athenaeum Theatre in Melbourne (February 1978), he played the key role of Major James Francis Thomas, who defended Morant at the infamous court martial. Jonathan was known in his profession for his work ethic and boundless energy. In fact, he soldiered on for many years after 1988, despite having undergone the trauma of heart transplant surgery. He also had a reputation for a wonderfully wicked sense of humour ...after all, he once described Rygel's most endearing traits on "Farscape" to be "biting people and farting helium"!
biography.name: Jonathan Hardy

biography.bio: Gerry Duggan was born in 1909 in Dublin, Ireland, UK. He was an actor, known for Goldfinger (1964), The Sundowners (1960) and The Servant (1963). He died on March 27, 1992 in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia.
biography.name: Gerry Duggan

biography.bio: Thomas Keneally was born on October 7, 1935 in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia as Thomas Michael Keneally. He is a writer and actor, known for Schindler's List (1993), The Chant of Jimmie Blacksmith (1978) and Silver City (1984). He has been married to Judith Martin since 1965. They have two children.
biography.name: Thomas Keneally

biography.placeOfBirth: St. Kilda East, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia
biography.bio: Sheila Florance was born on July 24, 1916 in St. Kilda East, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia as Sheila Mary Florance. She was an actress, known for Prisoner: Cell Block H (1979), Mad Max (1979) and A Woman's Tale (1991). She was married to Jan (John) Adam Balawaider and Roger Lightfoot Oyston. She died on October 12, 1991 in Melbourne.
biography.name: Sheila Florance

biography.bio: Simon Burke was born on October 8, 1961. He is an actor and producer, known for Devil's Playground (2014), The Devil's Playground (1976) and Miss Fisher enquête (2012).
biography.name: Simon Burke

biography.bio: John Diedrich was born on February 25, 1953 in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia as John Edwin Diedrich. He is known for his work on Special Squad (1984), Bluey (1976) and The Devil's Playground (1976). He has been married to Jo-Anne Robinson since 1982.
biography.name: John Diedrich

biography.bio: Alan Cinis was born on August 10, 1960 in Orange, New South Wales, Australia. He is an actor, known for Dark City (1998), Peter Pan (2003) and My Best Men (2011).
biography.name: Alan Cinis

biography.bio: Richard Morgan was born on August 12, 1958 in Hobart, Tasmania, Australia. He was an actor, known for Phar Lap (1983), Stingers (1998) and The Wicked (1987). He was married to Lisa. He died on December 23, 2006 in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.
biography.name: Richard Morgan

biography.bio: Rowan Currie is an actor, known for The Devil's Playground (1976).
biography.name: Rowan Currie

biography.bio: Gary Pixton is an actor, known for The Devil's Playground (1976).
biography.name: Gary Pixton

filmingLocations.location: Werribee Park, Werribee South, Victoria, Australia
